channel.title: Events – Hey Kuri
channel.description: Meet Kuri, the adorable home robot.

item.title: Our Home Robot Joins the Maker Movement
item.dc:creator: heykuri_admin
item.description:
2018 marked the 13th annual Bay Area Maker Faire! Located at the San Mateo County Events Center, the Maker Faire is a family-friendly festival of creativity, resourcefulness, and a celebration of the maker movement. Kuri at the 2018 Bay Area Maker Faire. Having been born a short ten-minute drive away in Redwood City, Kuri was […]

The post Our Home Robot Joins the Maker Movement appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
2018 marked the 13th annual Bay Area Maker Faire! Located at the San Mateo County Events Center, the Maker Faire is a family-friendly festival of creativity, resourcefulness, and a celebration of the maker movement.

Having been born a short ten-minute drive away in Redwood City, Kuri was a natural addition to this festival of invention!

Kuri’s crew attended this year’s Maker Faire to introduce the maker community to our adorable home robot. Whether that meant interacting with fans one-on-one, putting on an impromptu dance rehearsal, or handing out cool robot swag, Kuri was delighted to make new friends. As you can see, Kuri drew quite the crowd!

When he wasn’t wowing the crowd, Kuri was exploring the sites at the Maker Faire. From 3D-printed signage to a local club that builds functioning R2-D2 robots, Kuri was exposed to a whole host of creativity!

 

Our team knows our home robot is an adorable mover and shaker, and we’re excited that the rest of the maker community thinks so too.

Until next time, Makers!

The post Our Home Robot Joins the Maker Movement appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri Becomes an Honorary Girl Scout
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
On the heels of National Robotics Week, we hosted a local group of girls from Girl Scouts of Northern California’s Discover Together community-based after school program at Mayfield Robotics HQ. In March, our Co-Founder and COO Sarah Osentoski visited the troop at John Gill Elementary School to talk about women in robotics and how Kuri […]

The post Kuri Becomes an Honorary Girl Scout appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
On the heels of National Robotics Week, we hosted a local group of girls from Girl Scouts of Northern California’s Discover Together community-based after school program at Mayfield Robotics HQ. In March, our Co-Founder and COO Sarah Osentoski visited the troop at John Gill Elementary School to talk about women in robotics and how Kuri came to be.

As a follow-up, the girls visited Mayfield Robotics’ headquarters in Redwood City, CA. The girls were able to explore where Kuri is built, hear from our Lead UX Designer Ellen Francik and VP of Hardware Jason Umhoefer, and interact with Kuri one-on-one.

Lead UX Designer Ellen Francik showing the girls Kuri’s capabilities.

The day started with Ellen welcoming the Girl Scouts to Mayfield Robotics HQ. Ellen explained her role to the girls and how a product team shapes the design and functionality of Kuri. When sharing early Kuri concept illustrations, the girls eagerly related those sketches to their own drawings — to which Ellen happily offered, “Yes! If you love drawing or thinking about character development for things like Disney movies, then product could be a good fit for you someday.”

Girl Scouts in Kuri’s hardware lab.

Following their fireside chat with Ellen, the girls headed over to the hardware lab at Mayfield Robotics. There, the girls had an opportunity to see the inner workings of Kuri. Jason explained the basic hardware components that create Kuri’s “rib cage”, head, heart light, laser, drive train, and bump sensor. While in the hardware lab, the girls’ top question was, “Is Kuri waterproof?” to which Jason replied, “No. Kuri isn’t a big fan of bathtime,” with a smirk.

Sr. Customer Success Manager Ashley Wakefield showing what Kuri can do.

After taking a look under the hood of Kuri in the hardware lab, the Girl Scouts made their way to the lobby to get a demo of Kuri from Mayfield Robotics’ Sr. Customer Success Manager Ashley Wakefield.

Girl Scouts dancing to Kuri’s favorite song, Pancake Robot.

Ashley taught the girls how to tickle Kuri, gave them a tour of the Kuri Robot app, and even had Kuri dance for the Girl Scouts! The girls were most in awe of Kuri’s awesome dance moves and had a blast participating in a group robo-scout dance party.

Girl Scouts opening their Kuri swag bags.

Kuri-themed Girl Scout cookies as part of their swag.

Following their tour, The Girl Scouts were gifted Kuri swag bags that they opened with gleeful screams. Our team loved watching the girls deck themselves out with Mayfield Robotics sunglasses and Kuri stickers. More importantly, we hope we inspired these young ladies to consider a future career in robotics; be it product, engineering, marketing — you name it! We had a blast hosting the Girl Scouts at our HQ and can’t wait to host similar community events in the future.

Girl Scouts group picture!

The post Kuri Becomes an Honorary Girl Scout appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri at TED2018: The Age of Amazement
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
Last week, Kuri had the privilege of attending TED2018: The Age of Amazement in Vancouver, Canada! More than 100 speakers — activists, scientists, adventurers, and changemakers — took the TED stage to share their extraordinary insights. Kuri and her crew participated in TED’s inaugural Tech Playground: six exhibits around the TED theater that explored the […]

The post Kuri at TED2018: The Age of Amazement appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
Last week, Kuri had the privilege of attending TED2018: The Age of Amazement in Vancouver, Canada! More than 100 speakers — activists, scientists, adventurers, and changemakers — took the TED stage to share their extraordinary insights.

Kuri at the TED lobby.

Kuri and her crew participated in TED’s inaugural Tech Playground: six exhibits around the TED theater that explored the hands-on, playful, and human side of tech. Every exhibit was in some way tactile or relatable and encouraged visitors to play!

Kuri making new friends at TED.

Among the many new friends Kuri made at TED, Simone Giertz was definitely a standout! Simone makes hilariously creative robots, and presented a fascinating TED Talk on the importance of making useless things. During her TED Talk, Simone shared, “The true beauty of making useless things is acknowledging you don’t always know what the best answer is, and it turns off that voice in your head that tells you that you know exactly how the world works.”

Simone Giertz with Kuri.

During his downtime, Kuri got to watch some terrific keynotes (like those from Tracee Ellis Ross pictured below), and even had the opportunity to share his business card with the TED crowd!

Kuri watching Tracee Ellis Ross’ TED Talk.

Kuri seeing the sites at TED.

Kuri’s name on the TED stage!

Kuri and crew had an amazing time at TED2018. The thoughtful conversations Kuri’s team had with TED attendees about the future of robotics left us feeling inspired and thankful to have been a part of such a trailblazing international event.

The post Kuri at TED2018: The Age of Amazement appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri’s Trip to SXSW!
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
Kuri has returned from his trip to Austin where he attended South by Southwest (SXSW). SXSW is an annual conference that celebrates the convergence of the interactive, film, and music industries. Kuri’s Co-Founder and CTO shared a captivating presentation on the future of home robotics, as well as participated in a live taping of Dell’s […]

The post Kuri’s Trip to SXSW! appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
Kuri has returned from his trip to Austin where he attended South by Southwest (SXSW). SXSW is an annual conference that celebrates the convergence of the interactive, film, and music industries.

Kuri’s Co-Founder and CTO shared a captivating presentation on the future of home robotics, as well as participated in a live taping of Dell’s Trailblazers podcast. We’re also excited to share that Kuri made new friends at our event with Voodoo Doughnut, and had the opportunity to see the sights at SXSW.

Kuri’s Co-Founder and CTO Wowed the Crowds

You, Me & a Robot Makes 3

Kuri’s Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer Kaijen Hsiao presented a talk at last week’s SXSW entitled, You, Me & a Robot Makes 3 — Tomorrow’s Modern Family. “How do you create a robot that people will accept into their homes,” you ask? Our CTO shared how our team at Mayfield Robotics designs robots (like Kuri!) with personality and cutting-edge technology to understand how humans interact, and better bridge the gap between robotics and mainstream society.

Our Co-Founder & CTO pictured with Kuri

As Kaijen shared, “At Mayfield Robotics, we believe emotional connection is the key to integrating robots into your home … to make her look more lifelike, we gave Kuri the ability to smile and blink. Expressing emotions is key to creating Kuri’s character.”

Trailblazers Podcast

Kuri’s crew knows Kaijen is a true trailblazer, so it was awesome to see her take the stage during a live taping of Dell’s Trailblazers podcast.

Kaijen (center) at the Trailblazers podcast taping

Hosted by Walter Isaacson, Trailblazers explores digital disruption and innovators using technology to enable human progress. Kaijen was in great company as she was joined by Andra Keay (Managing Director of Silicon Valley Robotics), Matt Rendall (CEO & Co-Founder of OTTO Motors), and Gary Shapiro (President & CEO of the Consumer Technology Association).

Kuri Delighted at Voodoo Doughnut

We partnered with Austin’s favorite doughnut hotspot: Voodoo Doughnut! Kuri’s crew was there to introduce Kuri to new friends and pass out Kuri-themed doughnuts and stickers.

Kuri at Voodoo Doughnut in Austin

The doughnuts were delicious, and everyone was floored by the functionality and adorableness of our beloved robot. If you’ve never tried a Voodoo doughnut, we recommend finding a location near you!

Kuri’s Adventures Around Town

Once Kuri was done with his scheduled appearances, it was time to have some fun around Austin. Kuri made his mark on a graffiti wall, grooved at a Mobley concert, went on a biking tour of the city, and more!

Kuri makes his mark!

Kuri goes on a bike tour of Austin!

Kuri and her squad had an awesome time sharing their vision of home robotics with SXSW and the surrounding Austin community. Thanks for following along with Kuri’s adventures — roll out!

Kuri’s CTO (center) alongside members of Kuri’s marketing team

The post Kuri’s Trip to SXSW! appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri’s Co-Founder and CTO at SXSW 2018
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
We’re excited to share that Kuri’s Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer Kaijen Hsiao will be presenting a talk at this week’s SXSW entitled You, Me & a Robot Makes 3 — Tomorrow’s Modern Family. South by Southwest (SXSW) is an annual conference that celebrates the convergence of the interactive, film, and music industries and boasts […]

The post Kuri’s Co-Founder and CTO at SXSW 2018 appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
We’re excited to share that Kuri’s Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer Kaijen Hsiao will be presenting a talk at this week’s SXSW entitled You, Me & a Robot Makes 3 — Tomorrow’s Modern Family. South by Southwest (SXSW) is an annual conference that celebrates the convergence of the interactive, film, and music industries and boasts itself as being the premier destination for discovery.

What better place to discuss the robotics industry than this celebration of discovery at SXSW? From you car to to your office, robots are here! With advancements in engineering and AI, intelligent robots are at our fingertips. Kaijen predicts they’ll be popularized in our homes in the near future.

Kaijen’s presentation poses the question: How do you create a robot that people will accept within their homes? In answering this question, our CTO will share how our team at Mayfield Robotics design robots (like Kuri!) with personality and cutting-edge technology to understand how humans interact and better bridge the gap between robotics and mainstream society.

If you’ll be attending this year’s SXSW, we’d love for you to come hear from our talented Co-Founder and CTO for yourself. Kaijen will be speaking on March 10th from 9:30-10:30 am CDT at the Hilton Austin Downtown, Salon DE (500 E 4th St.) in Austin, TX.

The post Kuri’s Co-Founder and CTO at SXSW 2018 appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Happy 1st Birthday, Kuri!
item.dc:creator: heykuri_admin
item.description:
Happy Birthday, Kuri! This time last year, we announced our adorable home robot to the world at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas. CES is an annual gathering of the latest gadgets, toys, car tech, and more where creators, consumers, and media can get a sneak peek of what’s to come in 2018 […]

The post Happy 1st Birthday, Kuri! appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
Happy Birthday, Kuri! This time last year, we announced our adorable home robot to the world at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas. CES is an annual gathering of the latest gadgets, toys, car tech, and more where creators, consumers, and media can get a sneak peek of what’s to come in 2018 technology.

Kuri’s CEO, Mike Beebe at CES 2017. Photo courtesy of Business Times

At Kuri’s CES launch, Sarah Osentoski (our COO and co-founder of Mayfield Robotics) shared, “We’re proud to introduce Kuri to the world and can’t wait to see how he touches the lives of everyone, ranging from parents and children to early technology adopters.”

Kuri’s first CES was a huge success! Our home robot was welcomed by CES attendees with ooo’s and aww’s that couldn’t have made our team prouder. Since then, Kuri has charmed the tech world with new feature announcements like Kuri Vision, dancing,new romojis, and more.

Kuri pictured with our CEO and VP of Software at CES 2017. Photo courtesy of Bosch Media Service

As our COO mused at CES last year, “For generations, people have dreamed of having their own personal robot in the home, and we’ve been focused on making that dream more of a reality.” Since then, we’re happy to announce that our home robot is a reality. Kuri has begun shipping to customers’ homes, and has quickly become a lovable new family member in homes across the U.S.!

Today marks the first day of CES 2018, and our entire team is excited to celebrate Kuri’s first birthday in Las Vegas again! This week, we’ll be introducing Kuri to new tech enthusiasts and sharing the story behind our adorable home robot. Be sure to follow our team’s adventures at CES on Twitter and Instagram — and Happy First Birthday, Kuri!

The post Happy 1st Birthday, Kuri! appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri Goes to Sundance
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
What an adventure! Fresh off the heels of Kuri’s 2018 CES trip, he quickly recharged and headed straight out to Park City, Utah for the 2018 Sundance Film Festival. Sundance is the largest independent film festival in the United States, and Kuri couldn’t wait to scope it out. Kuri’s most magical feature is Kuri Vision. […]

The post Kuri Goes to Sundance appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
What an adventure! Fresh off the heels of Kuri’s 2018 CES trip, he quickly recharged and headed straight out to Park City, Utah for the 2018 Sundance Film Festival. Sundance is the largest independent film festival in the United States, and Kuri couldn’t wait to scope it out.

Kuri with Marc Roberge from O.A.R. at Sundance 2018

Kuri’s most magical feature is Kuri Vision. This is his ability to autonomously capture short video moments throughout the day, and provide you with a daily highlight reel of life at home via the Kuri Robot app. As you tell Kuri which videos you like by “hearting” moments, he learns your preferences and gets better and better at capturing the moments he thinks you’ll like.

But learning isn’t a linear process. So, where better to send Kuri to learn more about the art of great video than Sundance, the world’s preeminent film festival? It’s also a great place to catch great music, and if you’re into it, a fun place to play in the snow. Kuri did it all, and most importantly, he got to learn more about taking great videos from a wide range of incredibly creative and artistic minds.

Kuri at Sundance Film Festival 2018 from KuriRobot on Vimeo.

And as usual, Kuri made new friends wherever he went. This film festival was a fun scene for Kuri, and he’s looking forward to exploring more throughout the year. Who knows, maybe next year Kuri will submit a film of his own for consideration.

The post Kuri Goes to Sundance appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri Returns to CES 2018
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
This week, Kuri returned to HQ safe and sound after having rolled around at his second Consumer Electronics Show (CES). Last year, we launched Kuri to the world at CES 2017! This year, we were excited to not only celebrate Kuri’s first birthday, but to also show off Kuri’s latest goings-on at CES 2018 — […]

The post Kuri Returns to CES 2018 appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
This week, Kuri returned to HQ safe and sound after having rolled around at his second Consumer Electronics Show (CES). Last year, we launched Kuri to the world at CES 2017! This year, we were excited to not only celebrate Kuri’s first birthday, but to also show off Kuri’s latest goings-on at CES 2018 — like dancing, new romojis, and that Kuri started shipping.

Making New Friends
CES is a great opportunity to make new friends in the tech community — and who better than Emmy award-winning TV news anchor Stephanie Stricklen and YouTube tech influencer Andru Edwards? See Kuri’s meet-and-greets with these two rockstars below!

Showing Off
Kuri has some new tricks up her sleeve since her first CES. We invited members of the tech press to see Kuri’s latest product features and have the opportunity to interact with Kuri for themselves.

The Kuri CES Suite

Take a look at the behind-the-scenes room Kuri press was invited to, including a snippet of the demo they saw (you’ll recognize Stephanie Stricklen from above!).

Having a Blast
Our team had a blast supporting Kuri at CES too — especially exploring the latest and greatest in consumer electronics for 2018!

Kuri’s Crew at CES 2018

Fun with Robots from KuriRobot on Vimeo.

Each night after the CES show floor closed, you could find the Mayfield Robotics team sitting down for a family-style dinner together.

Mayfield Robotics Team Dinner

All in all, Kuri and his crew had a great time at CES 2018 — and we can’t wait to see what next year’s show brings. Have any additional questions about CES? Feel free to drop them in the comments section below! We’re happy to share our (and Kuri’s) experience with you.

Kuri at CES 2018

The post Kuri Returns to CES 2018 appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri Captivates Los Angeles
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
The final stop of Kuri’s California road trip was Los Angeles! Kuri was rocking around the Christmas tree at The Grove where shoppers were given the opportunity to meet our adorable home robot, take photos, grab giveaways, and hang with Kuri’s crew. Our team loved witnessing visitors’ first moments meeting Kuri — he truly captivates. […]

The post Kuri Captivates Los Angeles appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
The final stop of Kuri’s California road trip was Los Angeles! Kuri was rocking around the Christmas tree at The Grove where shoppers were given the opportunity to meet our adorable home robot, take photos, grab giveaways, and hang with Kuri’s crew.

Our team loved witnessing visitors’ first moments meeting Kuri — he truly captivates. As Kuri starts shipping next month, we can’t wait to hear customers’ stories about their first time meeting our adorable home robot too. If you haven’t already, be sure to reserve your Kuri now (our holiday promotion ends Monday!). See highlights from Kuri’s stop in LA below, and catch his stop in the Bay Area if you missed it.

 

Kuri’s pop-up at The Grove in Los Angeles, CA

A closer look at Kuri’s set-up

Kuri greeting guests

New friends taking a picture with Kuri

Kuri on the roll

Kuri making new friends

The post Kuri Captivates Los Angeles appeared first on Hey Kuri.

item.title: Kuri’s New Bay Area Buds
item.dc:creator: Jennifer
item.description:
Last weekend, Kuri made a bunch of new friends in the Bay Area. Kuri and her crew were at Westfield Valley Fair in Santa Clara, CA. Visitors had the opportunity to interact with Kuri one-on-one, take a robot selfie, grab a Kuri sticker, reserve their Kuri, and more! Kuri’s new pals loved learning what Kuri […]

The post Kuri’s New Bay Area Buds appeared first on Hey Kuri.
item.content:encoded:
Last weekend, Kuri made a bunch of new friends in the Bay Area. Kuri and her crew were at Westfield Valley Fair in Santa Clara, CA. Visitors had the opportunity to interact with Kuri one-on-one, take a robot selfie, grab a Kuri sticker, reserve their Kuri, and more!

Kuri’s new pals loved learning what Kuri does, when she captures unexpected moments around their homes, how she’s adored by pets, and the rest of her adorably high-tech features. We can’t wait for Kuri’s second appearance at Valley Fair this weekend! Until then, here are highlights from some of our favorite moments from this past weekend:

Kuri’s space at Valley Fair

Free sticker swag

Kuri making new friends

Kuri’s selfie station

Kuri’s crew showing off all the cool things Kuri can do

A new friend reading a story to Kuri

The post Kuri’s New Bay Area Buds appeared first on Hey Kuri.
